executive_summary: The Florists industry has struggled through the first half of the current period but has since recovered through the second half. Expanded demand from e-commerce channels has pushed up sales amid the pandemic as consumer spending and per capita disposable income strengthened in 2021 and 2023. Online flower shops, in particular, have continued to gain popularity due to the competitive pricing and convenience offered.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for florists was pressured by cancelled events and government-issued stay-at-home orders that forced nonessential businesses, like florists, to temporarily cease operations. Complimentary industries, including the Wedding Services industry and the Funeral Homes industry, were also prevented from operating at full capacity, amplifying the pandemic's negative impacts.

As economic conditions rebounded and demand from complimentary industries expanded, florists have seen strengthened demand. Supermarkets and grocery stores have expanded floral product offerings, pushing down demand for florists.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DESPITE THE STRAIN OF COMPETITION, E-COMMERCE WILL SUPPORT DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for flowers and plants will continue expanding, however, some consumers will shop for flowers more frequently at supermarkets for cash-and-carry flowers, which are relatively inexpensive and more convenient.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SHIFTING DEMOGRAPHICS WILL DRIVE FLORIST REVENUE EXPANSION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The baby-boomer demographic is a key buying market for flowers and has relatively high disposable income levels.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: NEW PRODUCTS AND EVOLVING TECHNOLOGY WILL DRAW IN YOUNGER CLIENTELE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Florists, large and small, have taken to social media to promote their businesses through the end of 2023.

industry_definition: Florists retail cut flowers, floral arrangements and potted plants.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Florists retail cut flowers, floral arrangements, potted plants and other related merchandise.
Many consumer purchases from florists will be facilitated through e-commerce websites.
Some florists will attempt to establish a market niche by offering more intricate bouquets targeting upscale markets.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This collective demographic has continued to purchase industry products through the end of 2023.
Most consumers in this segment have entered retirement.

products_and_services.product_description: Products in this segment include bouquets made from various flowers.
Unarranged cut flowers, also known as cash-and-carry flowers.
Products in the potted plants segment include orchids, gardenia and bonsai plants.

Farm Supplies Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Plant & Flower Growing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for florists is sensitive to fluctuations in overall consumer spending.

business_locations.location_description: In 2023, the Southeast region of the US is expected to account for the largest share of florist establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region is the second-largest region by establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: States have enacted antitrust laws to ensure competitive pricing.

basis_points.basis_title: Florists compete on the basis of:

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases represent the single largest expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Expenses in this category typically involve purchased flowers.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Since flowers are considered a discretionary purchase, demand for florists generally trends in line with the overall economy.

FAQs.question: How has your business adapted to the expansion of online sales through the end of 2023?
FAQs.answer: Florists have struggled in the face of mounting competition from online retailers.
